body.p: The neurotransmitter is released by postganglionic neurons of the parasympathetic nervous system and is rapidly catabolized by its enzyme, making the effects of parasympathetic nervous system activation very (duration) and (distribution).

The neurotransmitter is released by postganglionic neurons of the sympathetic nervous system (excluding release of Ach at sweat glands) and is not quickly taken up or degraded, making the effects of sympathetic nervous system activation very (duration) and (distribution).

feedback.p: Correct. Acetylcholine is released by postganglionic parasympathetic nervous system neurons.
Incorrect. Parasympathetic nervous system neurons do not release epinephrine or norepinephrine.

hint.p: The neurotransmitter released by postganglionic neurons in the parasympathetic nervous system is the same as the neurotransmitter released by preganglionic neurons in the parasympathetic nervous system and sympathetic nervous system.

feedback.p: Correct. Because this neurotransmitter is rapidly broken down after its release, its actions are short-lived.
Incorrect. This neurotransmitter is locally released and rapidly broken down by the enzyme acetylcholinesterase AChE, which means this neurotransmitter is very short-acting.

hint.p: This neurotransmitter is rapidly catabolized when it is released.

feedback.p: Correct. Acetylcholine is released at local synapses and broken down at the same local synapses.
Incorrect. Acetylcholine is released locally and broken down locally.

hint.p: This neurotransmitter is released at synapses and does not have access to blood supply.

feedback.p: Incorrect. Only sympathetic nervous system preganglionic neurons and sympathetic postganglionic neurons innervating sweat glands release Ach.
Correct. Epinephrine/norepinephrine are released by postganglionic sympathetic nervous system neurons in all cases except postganglionic neurons that innervate sweat glands.

hint.p: The neurotransmitter released by postganglionic neurons in the sympathetic nervous system is different from the neurotransmitter released by preganglionic neurons in the parasympathetic and sympathetic nervous system, except in the case where the target is sweat glands.

feedback.p: Incorrect. This neurotransmitter is not rapidly degraded.
Correct. This neurotransmitter is not rapidly degraded.

hint.p: This neurotransmitter is not rapidly degraded.

feedback.p: Incorrect. Sympathetic nervous system postganglionic neurons' release of epinephrine/norepinephrine is into the bloodstream, widespread throughout the body.
Correct. Release of epinephrine/norepinephrine by the chromaffin cells of the adrenal medullae into bloodstream assures widespread impact of these neurotransmitters.

hint.p: This neurotransmitter is released at target organs and tissues and into the bloodstream.
